result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew G Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge, by 05-10-16.  
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment without tax intercept.

Consecutive to: to any sentence.
TIME SERVED disposition

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew G Torres

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and 943.20(3)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 (TWO) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 (TWO) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 05-10-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered WITHOUT tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant to complete community service and continue making restitution payments.    With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Meyer Law Office, re restitition payment, received and filed. lms

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is looking for a new counselor thru Cedar Creek.  Defendant to begin community service at the United Way.  Defendant has submitted a restitution payment.    All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Meyer Law Office, received and filed. lms

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has been referred to Express thru Cedar Creek for testing.  Defendant has submitted to restitution payment.  Defense request a brief adjournment to speak with client's therapist regarding submission of documentation.  Review hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Cedar Creek Family Counseling, received and filed. lms

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant needs a more detailed report from monitoring agency.  Dates and results of test are needed.  Defendant needs to pay restitution.  Review hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Information.  Court STAYS entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record

Defense request for a plea date allowing time to obtain a DPA is approved.     Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 03-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Michael Lonski for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:LOST WORLD OF WONDERS.

Defendant Andrew G Torres in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Andrew G Torres in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALITY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
